channel.title: Help
channel.description: Okay well idk wtf happen, but some hacker hacked my pc and had this pop up.. [img]http://i53.tinypic.com/ka5ocp.png[/img] a little after he did that he turned my webcam on.. can someone please help me get rid of this!!!!

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @EMINEM_BEAST EMINEM BEAST™
item.description:
@EMINEM_BEAST wrote:

[quote=“ytuio9, post:26, topic:386637”]Again, turn your internet connection to that computer off. He should have no way to access that computer now. Then, from a secure computer (one with a good antivirus), start copying anti virus files to your first computer until you can install it.[/quote]Yeah I had the the computer offline for a while now, but I think I now have everything under control, I have a friend that knows what to do, so he’s gonna come over and get rid of it for me. Thanks for the help everyone!

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

Again, turn your internet connection to that computer off. He should have no way to access that computer now. Then, from a secure computer (one with a good antivirus), start copying anti virus files to your first computer until you can install it.

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @EMINEM_BEAST EMINEM BEAST™
item.description:
@EMINEM_BEAST wrote:

[quote=“TOMSCAPE BETA, post:24, topic:386637”][quote author=EMINEM BEAST™ link=topic=482402.msg3533439#msg3533439 date=1300380677]

@Tom: I came across this:
http://i1236.photobucket.com/albums/ff441/deferrante1/2.png
http://i1236.photobucket.com/albums/ff441/deferrante1/1-2.png
If i’m wrong correct me, but I’m guessing this has something to do with the hacking thats going on with my computer? :o if so any ideas what i can do now?

Edit: hes at it again, this guy keeps randomly opening new tabs then tries to go on runescape…

Many people name the virus svchost, get rid of all of them.
[/quote] When I try to remove it I get a message saying: “Cannot delete SVCHOST: Acess Denied. Make sure the disk is not full or write-protected.” And I same message with the other files.

Wait, what? Doesn’t the scanner you use have an option to remove them?[/quote]It does, but its faded out, so it doesn’t allow me to click “Remove threats”.

Read full topic

item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

[quote=“EMINEM BEAST™, post:13, topic:386637”][quote author=TOMSCAPE BETA link=topic=482402.msg3532848#msg3532848 date=1300315260]

[quote author=EMINEM BEAST™ link=topic=482402.msg3532847#msg3532847 date=1300315163]

He can, even if he couldn’t, that doesn’t mean his infected files shouldn’t be removed. You have to take into account what is saved on the PC and what features this may have such as FTP, RAT, keylogger. He can browse through all your files, and check your stored passwords until you rid him.
[/quote]its amazing what people will do for wealth on runescape… and so far i got no help on the HJT forum

Then follow what I said.
[/quote]Yeah i started doing that, and also, i bet you anything this is from that Frostie PVP server, with the cheatclient.com, ever since i checked out that server about a week ago, my computer has been acting strange…

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=482402.msg3532849#msg3532849 date=1300315387]
He knows your Runescape password, but you were smart enough to have a PIN. Good Make sure you change your RS password on a different computer, eh?[/quote] just finished changing it on my old computer.[/quote]

Well, now you know why I said you should steer clear of sites which contain Fileave/ripway/cheatclient references

I also said they should be censored, for this exact reason. As long as you follow what I said all will be fine, if you have issues either PM me or go to HJT.

Read full topic

[quote=“xxlukexx, post:11, topic:386637”]How much do you have on rs? and he will be sat at his comp trying all pins writing them down probabily.

What a nerd.[/quote] Ha, thats the funny part, my account was hacked a month ago and had everything stolen, so all i have on there right now is 300k from botting…

Read full topic

Davidi2:

He knows your Runescape password, but you were smart enough to have a PIN. Good Make sure you change your RS password on a different computer, eh?

Makes sense.

You might want to be careful, it’s evident he has remote access over you - he can see you enter the PIN. But humans aren’t as memorable as a keyloggers, so he obviously missed it.

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

EMINEM BEAST™:

No, i just told him to fuck off then i went on my other computer to post this, and so far nothing has changed on my pc… and I don’t even have administrative rights on that laptop…so now I’m thinking can he actually do anything?

He can, even if he couldn’t, that doesn’t mean his infected files shouldn’t be removed. You have to take into account what is saved on the PC and what features this may have such as FTP, RAT, keylogger. He can browse through all your files, and check your stored passwords until you rid him.

[quote=“TOMSCAPE BETA, post:2, topic:386637”]He has you infected, probably a RAT. Scanning won’t work because he’ll end the process - you need to scan when he’s asleep or in safe mode. He sounds immature and that he doesn’t know what he’s talking about so I wouldn’t be to worried.

I.e. NOD32, Malware Bytes etc

If you really are struggling visit a HJT board. He isn’t going to ‘destroy your PC’. The RAT most likely contains an array of extras i.e. keyloggers, webcam activaters, and general tools to make your life hell.

Turn your sound off, disconnect speaking, disable your webcam, don’t type anything important. If he doesn’t attempt to stop you, find the process and its file location, try to end it then deleting the file - or do it in safe mode. This is only if scanning fails though.

If you want to retake some idea of what he’s upto, re enable your UAC, he has probably disabled it.

Remember you don’t have to tell him anything, he won’t go away if you do, just want more.[/quote]

You have to watch the small details, the fact he knows you have a runescape account either reflects that you have been infected via a RSPS/Runescape type site/thing. Or the fact he’s been watching you play - never leave your PC turned on, alone - he will change things.

Small details such as this can give big insights into what the person has access to.

Read full topic

I.e. NOD32, Malware Bytes etc

If you really are struggling visit a HJT board. He isn’t going to ‘destroy your PC’. The RAT most likely contains an array of extras i.e. keyloggers, webcam activaters, and general tools to make your life hell.

Turn your sound off, disconnect speaking, disable your webcam, don’t type anything important. If he doesn’t attempt to stop you, find the process and its file location, try to end it then deleting the file - or do it in safe mode. This is only if scanning fails though.

If you want to retake some idea of what he’s upto, re enable your UAC, he has probably disabled it.

Remember you don’t have to tell him anything, he won’t go away if you do, just want more.[/quote] alright I’m going on the HJT forum, hopefully they can help remove this, thanks

Read full topic
